text: Speak with Aglaea and discuss countermeasures

title: Mission Description
content: Depleting her divine power,Triannemanages to sendTribbieandTrinnonaway from the battle. The heroes gather in the city to plan tactics for rescuing Trianne and hunting down the Flame Reaver.

speaker: Phainon
line: We're back, Aglaea.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I already know the good news. Tribbie's safe return is proof of that.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You should have come to me first, Phainon.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy, there's no need to scold Snowy... Okhema is currently in grave danger.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I know. It's beyond my imagination that the only two Titans humankind can still rely on fell in such quick succession... I've never seen the golden thread pulled this taut, as if it could snap at any moment.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Phainon... Tell us your plan. Time is of the essence.

text: Phainon recounts Anaxa 's discovery...

speaker: Tribbie
line: This being is not just hunting Titans, but taking the Coreflames , too?

speaker: Phainon
line: Yes, just like the Flame-Chase Journey is doing. Professor Anaxa thinks the Flame Reaver's arrival is likely a sign that the black tide has spread further.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Regardless of whether you're right, this being is still far more aggressive than we expected.

speaker: Phainon
line: But its madness is also an opportunity for us. If its goal is the Coreflame, then that means us humans can lure it into a trap.

speaker: Phainon
line: Anaxa had already left the holy city with Cerces ' Coreflame while we were on the way to the Abyss, so he can make preparations for the battlefield.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Tell me, what makes you think this won't end with us losing another Coreflame?

speaker: Phainon
line: Because this time, the power from beyond the sky is also at our side...

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ ( He / She ) is the key.

text: I knew it. Of course it's got to be me.
Really? Are you sure I can do it?
I have a Stellaron . Can we pass it off as a Coreflame?

speaker: Phainon
line: We need your other companion too.

speaker: Mem
line: Oh...

speaker: Mem
line: Do you mean... me?

speaker: Aglaea
line: I see. Phainon, that "battlefield" you mentioned...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Is it Castrum Kremnos ?

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ Yes. I'm sure everyone remembers the astonishing miracle ( Trailblazer ) performed with ( his / her ) companion during the battle with Nikador and how they awakened Castrum Kremnos' past.

speaker: Phainon
line: That will be the key to our victory — We will use Oronyx 's power to once again open a passage to the past and lure our enemy inside...

speaker: Phainon
line: Then, we'll "seal" the Flame Reaver in the Maze of Time.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Impressive. Oronyx has fallen, and Janus ' divine power already belongs to Okhema. Once we take back the Coreflame, the swordmaster will have no means of escape.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It's very clever, using the element of surprise instead of brute strength.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Can you do it, little one?

speaker: Mem
line: I just have to throw that black-cloaked guy into the past, and lock them there, right? With the memory fragments, I can open a door no problem. As for the rest...

speaker: Mem
line: ▶ Well, let's just say that (Trailblazer) and I can do anything as long as we're together!

text: That's right! We can do anything!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Yeah! Can you feel their fervent gazes? This is a big deal! We can't let everyone down!

text: Really? I'm not so sure about this...

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Aw, come on! Can't you feel their fervent gazes? This is a big deal! We can't let everyone down!

text: Really? Then I'm gonna make a wish!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Aw, come on! Can't you feel their fervent gazes? This is a big deal! We can't let everyone down!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Such enthusiasm. I'm glad to see you're confident.

speaker: Aglaea
line: By the way, the Council of Elders declared a state of emergency when Tribbie went missing. Caenis and her following have heard tell of the incident at the Grove and are galvanizing support in secret. I fear she'll make her move before the next assembly of the citizens.

speaker: Tribbie
line: What are they plotting...

speaker: Aglaea
line: That short-sighted politician likely believes the Chrysos Heirs have outlived their usefulness and is making preparations for her next step. That ugly side of humanity is something we'll have to deal with eventually.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...But that's a problem for another day. I've sent Castorice ahead to the Council with a message. She should be able to keep the situation under control for the time being.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Phainon, it is my hope that we can come to an understanding on this: We must take down the Flame Reaver in one go and retrieve the Coreflame, and in doing so, grant ourselves an advantage against the Council of Elders.

speaker: Phainon
line: Of course. You may count on me to lead the charge.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ I apologize for tasking you to spearhead the plan once again, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), but Okhema is currently beset by enemies from within and without.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The situation brooks no delay, and we have precious little time to confer and discuss the plan with you... That being said, you are the key to our success, and I shall respect any decision you make.

text: How do we make sure that the plan will work?

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: I may not be as masterful as Trianne when it comes to the Century Gate, but even I can open a nice, big gate if I have enough time.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: As for whether we can take back the Coreflame... that will be up to Anaxa's capabilities.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Based on what I know of him, he can do it.

text: How do we guarantee my safety?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I'll be honest — we can't.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: But the Flame Reaver will have step over my dead body if they wish to do you harm.

text: Whatever Mem's plan is, I'll follow.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Hooray! I was so worried that you'd be mad at me.

text: We reserve the right to withdraw at any time.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Of course. Should you feel fatigued after our confrontation with the Flame Reaver, you are free to withdraw from the battlefield. We will find another way.

speaker: Aglaea
line: We are grateful to you for your aid, and to the rest of you as well. Now, let us be off to begin the hunt.

speaker: Aglaea
line: May Kephale sharpen our gaze and grant us victory over the enemy.

text: Feels like we're missing someone.

speaker: Phainon
line: You mean Mydei ? He's dealing with a different problem.

speaker: Phainon
line: Don't worry. That man would never miss out on this fight.

text: Vortex of Genesis, Okhema

speaker: Hephaestion
line: Farewell, my dear friend. You must... lead us back home...

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: You and I, we're both the same... We feast on strife and fear...

speaker: Krateros
line: If you're truly capable of leading our people beyond this bloodstained fate, then prove it to me once more, Mydeimos.

speaker: Phainon
line: I knew you'd be here.

speaker: Mydei
line: I heard you're about to set off on an expedition.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's right. It's going to be a tough battle, and our destination is... turns out to be Castrum Kremnos.

speaker: Mydei
line: Is that why you're here? To pray to the dead Nikador ?

speaker: Phainon
line: No, just the opposite. I'm here to tell you...

speaker: Phainon
line: You can entrust the front line to us this time. You can't afford to lose your upcoming battle either.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph...

speaker: Mydei
line: Have you heard the story of Geocles the Mountainbreaker?

speaker: Phainon
line: Sounds like you've spoken with Chartonus . That's the name of the legendary Mountain Dweller , right?

speaker: Mydei
line: Let's have a chat before we go our separate ways.

speaker: Mydei
line: Chartonus told me that back in ancient times, the Mountain Dwellers lived in seclusion. They spent their days quarrying and gathering, living a simple and peaceful life away from strife.

speaker: Mydei
line: But Geocles was different. He resisted their traditional way of life, yearning for the world beyond the mountain. Their safe but humdrum culture was like fetters around him.

speaker: Phainon
line: He sounds a lot like you.

speaker: Mydei
line: Yes, that is why he, too, faced the same dilemma as I do. One day, during one of Geocles' many ventures beyond the mountain, he spied a battalion of Ladonians stationed at the foot of the mountain.

speaker: Mydei
line: The Ladonians were at war with their archenemies, the Campanians, and they used the mountain as a base to carry out guerrilla warfare operations. When Geocles, who had taught himself the common tongue, approached a soldier, he learned a shocking piece of news:

speaker: Mydei
line: The Ladonians were planning to plant mines and explosives all over the mountain, and then lure their enemies within. With danger lurking with every step, the Mountain Dwellers' homes were no longer safe. Geocles quickly returned to his village to bring the news to his people, but...

speaker: Phainon
line: Let me guess: They refused change and chose to put up with the situation instead?

speaker: Mydei
line: ...That's right. The Mountain Dwellers were fearful of even the smallest change to their lifestyle, let alone leaving their home. Despite the imminent war, the elders would rather negotiate for peace instead of leaving the mountains. This made Geocles both angry and sad.

speaker: Mydei
line: But he didn't give up. If you were in his shoes, what would you have done?

speaker: Phainon
line: Lead my people on a resistance, perhaps? I'm not sure. I can't think of a solution that would make everyone happy.

speaker: Mydei
line: "A solution that would make everyone happy," huh... That's how naive we are. Well, let me tell you what Geocles did.

speaker: Mydei
line: He took the Mountain Dwellers' store of gemstones and traded them with the Ladonians for a massive amount of gunpowder — but he didn't do this to fight the Campanians. Under the cover of night, he set ablaze the forests surrounding the settlement, forcing his people to flee the mountain.

speaker: Mydei
line: That great fire marked the beginning of Mountain Dweller history. Since then, their people became part of civilization, and giants became a common sight in the holy city. Meanwhile, that mountain they once lived in has turned into little more than foam inside the black tide.

speaker: Phainon
line: But leaving their homeland also brought many Mountain Dwellers misfortune. They —

speaker: Mydei
line: They were hunted by Kremnoans or enslaved. Indeed, that is undeniably also part of their history.

speaker: Mydei
line: But that is Geocles for you. The merits of his actions — or the lack thereof — have been scrutinized by many, but historians nevertheless hail him as the Mountainbreaker. Why do you think that is?

speaker: Mydei
line: It's simply because he took action and enacted change with his own hands. He didn't try to make everyone understand him, nor did he even waste time trying to make everyone happy.

speaker: Mydei
line: He started a great fire and burned the shackles of tradition to ashes, and then... forced everyone to march toward the coming of a new era.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...You've made up your mind, haven't you?

speaker: Mydei
line: I'll be leaving Okhema soon to fight the greatest darkness of this world... and to shoulder Nikador's destiny.

speaker: Mydei
line: So, listen well: If there comes a day when we meet again on the battlefield, and I stand opposed to the flame-chase...

speaker: Mydei
line: Remember to stab your sword into my back through my tenth thoracic vertebra. That's my weak spot, and the only way to kill me.

speaker: Phainon
line: You have my word.

speaker: Mydei
line: Go now. Your battlefield calls. Send that flame-thieving hyena to their death.

speaker: Mydei
line: But if you find yourselves with no other recourse, then pray to that blade in the sky...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...And loudly call out the name of the new god.

text: Start to entrap the Flame Reaver
(EnterExploratory ExcursionEntrap the Flame Reaver)
Speak with Phainon and start the entrapment

(If the Exploratory ExcursionEntrap the Flame Reaveris quit)
(Enter Exploratory ExcursionEntrap the Flame Reaver)
Head to the battlefield

title: Step Description
content: The final battle with the Flame Reaver takes place in Castrum Kremnos. Against this mysterious mighty foe, the Chrysos Heirs must fight with everything they have.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's the sound of an all-out war. Not the kind of ruckus Professor Anaxa can raise on his own.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's hurry. The battlefield is just ahead.

text: (Approach the first landing)

speaker: Phainon
line: No way... A Kremnoan?

text: (Idle chats)

speaker: Kremnoan Soldier A
line: Nikador is with us!

speaker: Kremnoan Soldier B
line: We won't bring dishonor to the king!

speaker: Kremnoan Soldier C
line: For Kremnos! For the king!

speaker: Kremnoan Soldier D
line: Glory to the Godshield Brigade!

text: (Approach the marked warrior)

speaker: Phainon
line: I didn't think she'd manage to send the Kremnoans to assist. Brave warrior, what's the situation on the front line?

speaker: Exhausted Kremnoan
line: ...An Okheman? Why are you here...?

speaker: Phainon
line: What...? Didn't Aglaea tell you? We have been instructed to assist you in trapping the Flame Reaver.

speaker: Exhausted Kremnoan
line: Aglaea... That vile usurper! I spit on her name!

speaker: Exhausted Kremnoan
line: Our king... will be back soon... He'll be able to... deal with you... and that black-robed...

text: A hoarse curse lodged in his throat, refusing to escape. Moments later, he convulsed, his head drooping as his spirit departed his body, drifting towards the abode of Thanatos .

speaker: Phainon
line: ...The Kremnoans really are just like their king.

speaker: Phainon
line: Rest in peace. May your glory last forever.

text: Join the battle

speaker: Phainon
line: Did they come to fight on their own accord? Or...?

text: (Idle chats)

speaker: Kremnoan Soldier A
line: I can still... fight...

speaker: Kremnoan Soldier B
line: You must become king...

speaker: Kremnoan Soldier C
line: That sound... It pierces my ears...

speaker: Kremnoan Soldier D
line: I can't see...

text: (Approach the staircase)

speaker: Phainon
line: We're almost there...

text: (Approach Tribbie)

speaker: Tribbie
line: Once we take back the Coreflame, Janus ' passage will open. When that happens, you must evacuate immediately. Don't stay behind.

speaker: Tribbie
line: The rest... will be up to how well we work together.

speaker: Phainon
line: But remember what Mydei said before? "Cast aside all distractions once you're on the battlefield"...

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go, partner! Today, destiny shall stand with us!

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Anaxa
children.line: Finally.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: Mem... It's all yours!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Mem~

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Repent in the memories of the dead —

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: — Executioner!

text: (Cutscene ends)
(Begin battle againstFlame Reaver of the Deepest Dark)

speaker: Anaxa
line: You sure know how to keep a man waiting...

speaker: Anaxa
line: Any later, and I fear the Titan would have sacrificed me.

speaker: Cerces
line: Heh. Frail child of humanity... 'tis more effort keeping you hale and whole against that blade than it is in seeking the truth of the world.

text: (When Flame Reaver uses But Suffering is Essential)

speaker: Phainon
line: They're trying to overwhelm us with numbers... Split up and take them out!

speaker: Cerces
line: Oho, what a spirited display, "Deliverer."

text: (Below 10% HP)

speaker: Phainon
line: Get ready, Prof! We can't hold out much longer!

speaker: Anaxa
line: Quiet! I know what I'm doing!

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Anaxa
children.line: At long last!

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Century gate... Open!

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: How embarrassing, "Deliverer."

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Heh. You didn't come down from the sky?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: This city is mine anyway...

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: So why shouldn't I go through the front door?

text: (Cutscene ends)
(Continue battle againstFlame Reaver of the Deepest Dark, now in phase two)

speaker: Mydei
line: Minion of the black tide, I, king of the Kremnoan legion, will be your opponent today.

speaker: Cerces
line: Long time no see... Nikador.

text: (While using Blood of "Strife" for the first time)

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph, such petty tricks!

text: (While using Blood of "Strife" subsequent times)

speaker: Mydei
line: Rejoice, for I grant you the honor of sharing your final resting place with Kremnos' departed heroes!

text: (When Flame Reaver uses Cry Not For The Discarded)

speaker: "Flame Reaver"
line: Vanity... leads to self-destruction.

speaker: "Flame Reaver"
line: I am but sending a dynasty to its end.

speaker: Mydei
line: Well fought! That was a good opener to the ceremony!

speaker: Mydei
line: Now, we honor the fallen gods with this fight to the death!

text: (When Flame Reaver uses Cry Not For The Discarded again?‍[guessed the condition by dialogue])

speaker: Phainon
line: Not the same trick again... Mydei, I'll follow your lead.

speaker: Mydei
line: This is nothing to be worried about. Just fight to your heart's content!

text: (When Flame Reaver is reduced to 1% HP)

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: ...It's time to end this.

speaker: Mydei
line: Come! The Kremnoans' spear always finds their mark — Fate itself shall forge my speartip!

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Heroic souls of Strife, heed my call...

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: I am the Lance of Fury...

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: The agony this world needs!

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Witness this...

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: A new god has come to Castrum Kremnos.

text: (Cutscene ends)

speaker: Chattering Citizens
line: Look, the warriors have returned!

speaker: Chattering Citizens
line: But... are the rumors true? Has Oronyx fallen?

speaker: Chattering Citizens
line: It's as the Council of Elders said. We face a dangerous threat, yet the Chrysos Heirs are only inciting more chaos. They don't care about the people's safety...

speaker: Chattering Citizens
line: They really gave the Coreflame of "Strife" to a Kremnoan at the end...

speaker: Mydei
line: What a noisy crowd...

speaker: Phainon
line: This... doesn't feel right.

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's probably because Oronyx is gone...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Oronyx was a generous Titan in the eyes of the people. They graced us with miracles, allowing humanity to reap many a convenience from the past...

speaker: Phainon
line: What they don't know is that the Titan didn't do all of that of its own volition.

speaker: Phainon
line: Regardless, the Titan has fallen, and we must surrender Oronyx 's Coreflame.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh... a meeting with that woman again so soon? I just can't catch a break.

speaker: Phainon
line: Professor Anaxa, why don't you... find someplace to rest first?

speaker: Phainon
line: Matters that require Aglaea's attention are piling up. You two meeting again will — forgive my honesty — only distract her.

speaker: Phainon
line: Just... try to stay on your best behavior, if you know what I mean.

speaker: Anaxa
line: That's not up to me, I'm afraid. I've been trapped in her prison the moment I set foot in this holy city. The price of having a Titan living in my head, I suppose.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Don't worry. I don't want trouble either.

text: He and Aglaea don't get along, huh?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: They have... differences in ideology.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Alright, I suppose that's putting it lightly. Don't worry, you'll figure out the intricacies of these relationships sooner or later.

text: That prof's kinda eccentric.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Professor Anaxa can be a bit... Unrestrained. Don't worry. You'll get used to it.

speaker: Mydei
line: I'm sure you don't need my help handling Oronyx 's Coreflame, so I'll be off. I have some personal matters to attend to.

speaker: Tribbie
line: It somehow feels like De has closed himself off even more after he completed his trial.

speaker: Phainon
line: Yeah. A lot has happened in the past few days...

speaker: Phainon
line: You've been lost in thought for a while now too, Tribbie. Did Trinnon bring news?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Yes... She has found Trianne.

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...She was at the bottom of the valley outside the temple. But... that's where the good news ends.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...I'm sorry.

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's alright. They also found someone else besides Trianne.

speaker: Tribbie
line: He was no better than a corpse when Trinnon and Hyacine arrived. He had suffered more cuts than could be counted and leaped off a cliff from a great height, all to free Trianne's body from the clutches of the black-robed swordmaster.

speaker: Phainon
line: What a brave soul. Do we know who he is?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Yes...

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's Krateros.

text: Not long ago...

line: ...Stop!

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Heh.

speaker: Krateros
line: If you want this girl dead, you'll have to kill me first.

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: How ludicrous... Your body, made of flesh and blood as it is, will not survive more than a single strike from me.

speaker: Krateros
line: "Valorous Death Before Glorious Return." As a Kremnoan, I know not the fear of death.

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: She's lost her divinity. I have no interest in an empty shell.

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: But answer me this, child of Strife. Why do you raise your shield for her?

speaker: Krateros
line: Hmph...

speaker: Krateros
line: As the leader of the Godshield Brigade's elite, I protected the king against the black tide with this very shield. And I've done this over and over, hundreds and thousands of times...

speaker: Krateros
line: A pathetic killer like you could never understand the weight it bears.

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Pity.

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Then crumble like rusted iron.

speaker: Krateros
line: Good! Supreme glory shall be mine as I indulge in the libations and incense offered by my descendants!

speaker: Krateros
line: Come, let us fight! For Kremnos! For my king!

speaker: Krateros
line: ...For Amphoreus !

speaker: Aglaea
line: We foresaw this cruel parting a thousand years ago. Today is but a reminder of that bitter taste.

speaker: Hyacine
line: But Lady Aglaea, I don't understand... It wasn't life itself that Lady Trianne lost...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Why does she look like she really turned into a doll? I... I don't understand...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Don't be sad, Hyacine. Trianne has used up her borrowed time from Janus , that's all.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Her spirit is now riding the west wind, flying ahead to a world free of sorrow.

speaker: Hyacine
line: If a world like that truly exists...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Does that mean everyone from the Grove is there too?

speaker: Aglaea
line: It exists, Hyacine. Do you not remember? The prophecy that guides the Chrysos Heirs is the voice of Kephale before it fell silent.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It loves all of its creations dearly, and would never bear to lead us astray with lies.

speaker: Aglaea
line: What about the Kremnoan veteran? How is he doing?

speaker: Hyacine
line: The Twilight Courtyard has done all we can. Even so, we've only managed to keep him from breathing his last.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I had to use the Sky Priests' techniques to help him walk again, but if light ever disappears from Okhema for good... No, let's hope that never happens.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This is already nothing short of miraculous. When we found Krateros, he was no better than a corpse.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The Parting Hour is upon us, yet the golden thread runs slack. The heroes have returned with their spoils.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Everyone, please take this opportunity to rest and prepare for what awaits us.

text:
(ObtainCoreflame of Time)
(UnlockAchievementWarrior, Why Do You Question Thy Origins?)
Report back to Aglaea

title: Mission Description
content: Depleting her divine power, Trianne manages to send Tribbie and Trinnon away from the battle. The heroes gather in the city to plan tactics for rescuing Trianne and hunting down the Flame Reaver.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You've returned unscathed and brought tidings of triumph. Truly a moment worthy of celebration.

text: (Approach Aglaea)

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ It's incredible to think that we returned Nikador 's Coreflame not so long ago... It wouldn't be an exaggeration to say that (Trailblazer) and your friend's arrival has melted the glaciers of history.

text: This is what Trailblazing is.
Where a Nameless goes, trouble follows.
We've melted a real glacier before...

speaker: Aglaea
line: You could say this is the true face of history. It slumbered for a thousand years, only to awaken for this one moment. Alas, now is not the time for a study of history.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I do not see Anaxa around. Was this under your instructions, Phainon?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Yes. It just seems much more efficient than letting you two go at it endlessly.

speaker: Aglaea
line: A rash decision. After all, he still bears a Coreflame with him.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I do concur with your assessment of efficiency, though. Now, let us table the issue concerning him for the moment. The more urgent matter is the Coreflame of Oronyx .

speaker: Aglaea
line: The Chrysos Heirs had initially crafted a plan regarding the order to return the Coreflames. For Titans like Oronyx and Cerces , who harbor no intentions of harming humanity, our strategy entailed assuming their divinity only at the very end.

speaker: Aglaea
line: But this unforeseen turn of events has thrown everything into disarray.

speaker: Tribbie
line: If we don't return the Coreflames to the Vortex of Genesis and we leave the Titans' divine positions vacant... we can't even begin to imagine the disaster that would follow!

speaker: Tribbie
line: But the most pressing issue at hand... is that we haven't found the Chrysos Heir capable of bearing Oronyx 's divinity .

speaker: Aglaea
line: Phainon, Castorice, Mydei, and Hyacine... Tribbie and I devoted a millennium scouring the world, only to find these few people.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Only a chosen few possess the capacity to assume divinity, the elite among the Chrysos Heirs. We would never hastily extend our invitation without first verifying their potential to bear such power.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Yet we cannot compel anyone into divinity, as it would be no different from sentencing them to the gallows.

speaker: Phainon
line: Truly a dilemma...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Yeah...

speaker: Mem
line: Well...

speaker: Mem
line: ▶ How about letting (Trailblazer) give it a try?

text: I've been waiting for someone to say that, friend.
So, you're okay with sentencing me to the gallows?
The owner isn't liable for their pet's words.

speaker: Mem
line: I'm serious! You're special to Amphoreus, and we all know that. Now, about Oronyx ...

speaker: Mem
line: The one projected me into this world and granted me this body... Isn't Oronyx just a little Titan even more capricious than a child?

text: Mydei has arranged all his affairs. Now, it is time to go home...
